The '''[[social stigma]] of [[obesity]]''' has created negative psychosocial impacts and has caused disadvantages of [[overweight]] and [[obesity|obese]] people.<ref>{{cite news|title=Deutsche werden immer dicker|url=http://www.mopo.de/news/deutsche-werden-immer-dicker/-/5066732/6212728/-/index.html|publisher=[[Hamburger Morgenpost]]|date=May 9, 2001|accessdate=March 8, 2011|language=German}}</ref><ref name="Süddeutsche1">{{cite news|title=Dicke sind faul und dumm|url=http://www.sueddeutsche.de/leben/adipositas-dicke-sind-faul-und-dumm-1.598030|publisher=[[Süddeutsche Zeitung]]|date=August 11, 2008|accessdate=March 8, 2011|language=German}}</ref> The social stigma is from a young age to adulthood.<ref name="Süddeutsche1"/> Several studies from the United States along with studies from the [[University of Marburg]] and [[University of Leipzig]] have shown that some people consider overweight and obese people as weak-willed, lazy and less intelligent compared to thin people.<ref name="Süddeutsche1"/>
==Adulthood== [[Overweight]] and [[obesity|obese]] people [[Marriage|marries]] less often, has fewer opportunities in education, labor-market and income earned compared to thin people.<ref name="Süddeutsche1"/>
